about.title: About me
about.description:
I'm Francisco, a Web UI engineer from Monterrey, Mexico, now living in The Woodlands, Texas, fully authorized to work in the United States.

Here's what I actually do: I take messy, fragile frontends and turn them into scalable, testable systems. Not just "nice UI" — I care about architecture, state management, performance and DX. Angular is my main weapon, but I also work with React, and I'm a genuinely fast learner: I pick up new tools, libraries and patterns quickly and put them into production safely.

Most developers either understand design or understand the business. I focus on both. While others argue about libraries, I'm shipping experiences that load fast, are accessible, rank well on SEO and actually move business metrics.

I've shipped SaaS products like Shelfie (AI-powered product image enhancer for small retailers) and I've built enterprise solutions for global brands through Globant in sectors like retail, travel and media. My GitHub and side projects are proof, not promises.

The result? Frontends that are maintainable for the team, enjoyable for the user, and valuable for the business.

When I'm not coding, I'm usually experimenting with new tools, gaming, or helping friends debug their own projects and setups.

I don't just build components. I build systems that let teams ship faster without losing quality.
